page.title: 06CHANGING TIMES
page.content: {Changing Times Continued.. large baskets of Hot Cross buns round the village.As children traffic was no problem,we played{Whip & Top}in the street.The top was placed in a convenient hole at the side of the road & then whipped until it spun,then we kept it going to school.We employed a ploughman, two maids,a gardener and a chauffeur.The villagers found work as farm labourers, thatchers or in service at the big houses.The present village is no longer close knit.It has become a commuters village,people coming from the towns,going to the towns to do shopping,sending their children to schools outside.The traffic has increased so that pavements have been built.The village {had}a shop/post-office,garage,timber- factory,Red Horse Inn,market garden & a cinema once a week in the vill.hall.
